original: 2. Gotamivatthadānapañha
translated: The Questions of Gotama’s Robe

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā mātucchāya mahāpajāpatiyā gotamiyā vassikasāṭikāya
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā mātucchāya mahāpajāpatiyā gotamiyā vassikasāṭikāya
translated: “Though, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One to his maternal aunt Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī when she was offering a rainy-season robe:

original: dīyamānāya ‘saṅghe, gotami, dehi, saṅghe te dinne ahañceva pūjito bhavissāmi saṅgho cā’ti.
analyzed: dīyamānāya saṅghe gotami dehi saṅghe te dinne aham ca iva pūjitaḥ bhavissāmi saṅghaḥ ca ati
translated: ‘Give it to the Order, Gotamī, when it is given to the Order you will have honoured me and the Order,’

original: Kiṁ nu kho, bhante nāgasena, tathāgato saṅgharatanato na bhāriko na garuko na dakkhiṇeyyo,
analyzed: kim nu kho bhante nāgasena tathāgataḥ saṅgha ratanataḥ na bhārikaḥ na garukaḥ na dakkhiṇeyyaḥ
translated: was the Realised One not more valuable than the Jewel of the Order,

original: yaṁ tathāgato sakāya mātucchāya sayaṁ piñjitaṁ sayaṁ luñcitaṁ sayaṁ pothitaṁ sayaṁ
analyzed: yam tathāgataḥ sakāya mātucchāya sayam piñjitam sayam luñcitam sayam pothitam
translated: that the Realised One, when a rainy-season robe woven by himself, carded by himself, spun by himself,

original: kantitaṁ sayaṁ vāyitaṁ vassikasāṭikaṁ attano dīyamānaṁ saṅghassa dāpesi.
analyzed: kantitam sayam vāyitam vassika sāṭikam attanaḥ dīyamānam saṅghassa dāpesi
translated: dyed by himself, dried by himself, was being given to him, had it given to the Order?

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, tathāgato saṅgharatanato uttaro bhaveyya adhiko vā visiṭṭho
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena tathāgataḥ saṅgha ratanataḥ uttaraḥ bhaveyya adhikaḥ vā visiṭṭhaḥ
translated: If, revered Nāgasena, the Realised One was superior, or greater, or more worthy of offerings than the Jewel of the Order,

original: vā, ‘mayi dinne mahapphalaṁ bhavissatī’ti na tathāgato mātucchāya sayaṁ piñjitaṁ
analyzed: vā mayi dinne mahapphalam bhavissati iti na tathāgataḥ mātucchāya sayam
translated: then the Realised One would not have had a rainy-season robe woven by himself, carded by himself,

original: sayaṁ luñcitaṁ sayaṁ pothitaṁ vassikasāṭikaṁ saṅghe dāpeyya, yasmā ca kho, bhante
analyzed: sayam luñcitam sayam pothitam vassika sāṭikam saṅghe dāpeyya yasmai ca kho bhante
translated: and the robe made from rags picked up here and there, he should give it to the Order. But because, revered sir,

original: nāgasena tathāgato attānaṁ na patthayati na upanissayati, tasmā tathāgato mātucchāya
analyzed: nāgasena tathāgataḥ attānam na patthayati na upanissayati tasmai tathāgataḥ mātucchāya
translated: the Tathāgata does not expect anything of himself, does not depend on himself, therefore the Tathāgata gave that rainy-season robe to the Order through his aunt,

original: taṁ vassikasāṭikaṁ saṅghassa dāpesī”ti.
analyzed: tam vassika sāṭikam saṅghassa dāpesi iti
translated: the Gotami Pajāpatī the Great.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā mātucchāya mahāpajāpatiyā gotamiyā vassikasāṭikāya dīyamānāya ‘saṅghe, gotami, dehi, saṅghe te dinne ahañceva pūjito bhavissāmi saṅgho cā’ti.
analyzed: bhāsitam peta mahā rāja bhagavatā mātucchāya mahāpajāpatiyāḥ gotamiyāḥ vassika sāṭikāya dīyamānāya saṅghe gotami dehi saṅghe te dinne aham ca iva pūjitaḥ bhavissāmi saṅghaḥ ca ati
translated: “This was said, sire, by the Blessed One when the rainy-season robe was being given to the Gotami Pajāpatī the Great, his aunt: ‘Give it to the Order, Gotami, in giving it to the Order you will honour me and the Order.’

original: Taṁ pana na attano patimānanassa avipākatāya na adakkhiṇeyyatāya, api ca kho, mahārāja,
analyzed: tam pana na attanaḥ pati mānanassa avipāka tāya na adakkhiṇeyya tāya api ca kho mahā rāja
translated: But that was not because he did not expect anything for himself, nor because he was not worthy of offerings, but rather, sire,

original: hitatthāya anukampāya anāgatamaddhānaṁ saṅgho mamaccayena cittīkato bhavissatīti
analyzed: hita atthāya anukampāya anāgata maddhānam saṅghaḥ mamaccayena cittīkataḥ bhavissati iti
translated: because he had compassion on the future time, thinking: ‘After my passing away the Order will be honoured.’

original: vijjamāneyeva guṇe parikittayanto evamāha—
analyzed: guṇe evam āha
translated: And so, while his own virtues were being proclaimed, he said:

original: ‘saṅghe, gotami, dehi, saṅghe te dinne ahañceva pūjito bhavissāmi saṅgho cā’ti.
analyzed: saṅghe gotami dehi saṅghe te dinne aham ca iva pūjitaḥ bhavissāmi saṅghaḥ ca ati
translated: ‘Give it to the Order, Gotami, in giving it to the Order you will honour me and the Order.’

original: Yathā, mahārāja, pitā dharamānoyeva amaccabhaṭabaladovārikaanīkaṭṭhapārisajjajanamajjhe
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja pitā amacca bhaṭa balada uvārika anīkaṭṭha pārisajja jana majjhe
translated: As, sire, a father, while still living, is in the midst of his ministers, his army, his door-keeper, his guards, his retinue, his people and his subjects,

original: rañño santike puttassa vijjamānaṁyeva guṇaṁ pakitteti ‘idha ṭhapito anāgatamaddhānaṁ
analyzed: rañño santike puttassa vijjamānayā iva guṇam pakitteti idha ṭhapitaḥ
translated: Just as, sire, a father, while still alive, extols the qualities of his son who is present in the midst of the ministers, the army, the door-keepers, the guards, the courtiers and the people,

original: janamajjhe pūjito bhavissatī’ti.🔽Evameva kho, mahārāja, tathāgato hitatthāya anukampāya anāgatamaddhānaṁ saṅgho mamaccayena cittīkato bhavissatīti vijjamāneyeva guṇe pakittayanto evamāha—
analyzed: jana majjhe pūjitaḥ bhavissati iti  evam eva kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ hita atthāya anukampāya anāgatam addhānam saṅghaḥ mamaccayena cittīkataḥ bhavissati iti vijjamāne iya iva guṇe pakittayantaḥ evam āha
translated: saying: ‘When I am dead, he will be placed here and in the future time he will be honoured in the midst of the people.’

original: ‘saṅghe, gotami, dehi, saṅghe te dinne ahañceva pūjito bhavissāmi saṅgho cā’ti.
analyzed: saṅghe gotami dehi saṅghe te dinne aham ca iva pūjitaḥ bhavissāmi saṅghaḥ ca ati
translated: Even so, sire, the Tathāgata, out of compassion for the future time, extols the qualities of the Order which will be honoured, saying: ‘Give, Gotamī, to the Order. In giving to the Order you will honour me and the Order.’

original: Na kho, mahārāja, tāvatakena vassikasāṭikānuppadānamattakena saṅgho tathāgatato adhiko nāma hoti visiṭṭho vā.
analyzed: na kho mahā rāja tāvatakena vassika sāṭikā anuppadāna mattakena saṅghaḥ tathāgatataḥ adhikaḥ nāma hoti visiṭṭhaḥ vā
translated: But, sire, it is not only because of the making of the robe for the rainy season that the Order is superior to the Tathāgata or distinguished.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, mātāpitaro puttānaṁ ucchādenti parimaddanti nahāpenti sambāhenti,
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja mātā pitaro puttānam ucchādenti parimaddanti nahāpenti sambāhenti
translated: Just as, sire, mothers and fathers feed their children, fondle them, bathe them, and bring them up,

original: api nu kho, mahārāja, tāvatakena ucchādanaparimaddananahāpanasambāhanamattakena ‘putto
analyzed: api nu khalu mahā rāja tāvatakena ucchādana parimaddana nahāpana sambāhana mattakena puttaḥ
translated: Is it only by the mere act of washing, massaging, bathing and fondling a son,🔽

original: mātāpitūhi adhiko nāma hoti visiṭṭho vā’”ti?
analyzed: mātā pitūhi adhikaḥ nāma hoti visiṭṭhaḥ vāti
translated: Would the son, sire, by virtue of that mere bathing, anointing, massaging and shampooing, be superior to his parents or more distinguished?”

original: “Na hi, bhante, akāmakaraṇīyā, bhante, puttā mātāpitūnaṁ, tasmā mātāpitaro puttānaṁ ucchādanaparimaddananahāpanasambāhanaṁ karontī”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhante a kāma karaṇīyāḥ bhante puttāḥ tasmai mātā pitaraḥ puttānam ucchādana parimaddana na hāpana sambāhanam karonti iti
translated: “No, revered sir, because the parents are not to be disobeyed by the son, therefore the parents do the bathing, anointing, massaging and shampooing for the son.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, na tāvatakena vassikasāṭikānuppadānamattakena saṅgho tathāgatato adhiko nāma hoti visiṭṭho vāti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja na tāvatakena vassika sāṭikā anuppadāna mattakena saṅghaḥ tathāgatataḥ adhikaḥ nāma hoti visiṭṭhaḥ vāti
translated: “Even so, sire, the Order is not superior to the Tathāgata or more distinguished by virtue of that mere making of the rainy-season robe.

original: Api ca tathāgato akāmakaraṇīyaṁ karonto mātucchāya taṁ vassikasāṭikaṁ saṅghassa dāpesi.
analyzed: api ca tathāgataḥ a kāma karaṇīyam karontaḥ mātucchāya tam vassika sāṭikam saṅghassa dāpesi
translated: But the Tathāgata, sire, doing what was not to be done, gave that rainy-season robe to the Order through his aunt.

original: Yathā vā pana, mahārāja, kocideva puriso rañño upāyanaṁ āhareyya, taṁ rājā upāyanaṁ aññatarassa bhaṭassa vā balassa vā senāpatissa vā purohitassa vā dadeyya.
analyzed: yathā vā pana mahā rāja kocid eva purisaḥ raññaḥ upāyanam āhareyya tam rājā upāyanam aññatarassa bhaṭassa vā balassa vā senāpatissa vā purohitassa vā dadeyya
translated: Or, sire, just as if some person were to bring a present for the king, and the king were to give that present to some soldier or to some of his army or to his general or to his chaplain,

original: Api nu kho so, mahārāja, puriso tāvatakena upāyanapaṭilābhamattakena raññā adhiko nāma hoti visiṭṭho vā”ti?
analyzed: api nu kho saḥ mahā rāja puriso tāvatakena upāyana paṭilābha mattakena raññā adhikaḥ nāma hoti visiṭṭhaḥ vā ati
translated: But is that man thereby superior to the King or more distinguished?”

original: “Na hi, bhante, rājabhattiko, bhante, so puriso rājūpajīvī, taṭṭhāne ṭhapento rājā upāyanaṁ detī”ti.
analyzed: na hi bhante rāja bhattikaḥ bhante saḥ purisaḥ rāja upajīvī tad ṭṭhāne ṭhapentaḥ rājā upāyanam deti iti
translated: “No, revered sir, he is a royal servant, he is dependent on the King, and the King gives him his livelihood.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, na tāvatakena vassikasāṭikānuppadānamattakena saṅgho tathāgatato adhiko nāma hoti visiṭṭho vā, atha kho tathāgatabhattiko tathāgatūpajīvī.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja na tāvatakena vassika sāṭikā anuppadāna mattakena saṅghaḥ tathāgatataḥ adhikaḥ nāma hoti visiṭṭhaḥ vā atha kho tathāgata bhattikaḥ tathāgata upajīvī
translated: “Even so, sire, the Order is not thereby superior to the Tathāgata or more distinguished, but it is dependent on the Tathāgata and the Tathāgata gives it its livelihood.

original: Taṭṭhāne ṭhapento tathāgato saṅghassa vassikasāṭikaṁ dāpesi.
analyzed: tad ṭṭhāne ṭhapentaḥ tathāgataḥ saṅghassa vassika sāṭikam dāpesi
translated: The Tathāgata, placing it in a suitable place, has the rainy-season robe given to the Order.

original: Api ca, mahārāja, tathāgatassa evaṁ ahosi ‘sabhāvapaṭipūjanīyo saṅgho, mama santakena
analyzed: api ca mahā rāja tathāgatassa evam ahosi sabhāva paṭipūjanīyaḥ saṅghaḥ mama santakena
translated: But, sire, this occurred to the Tathāgata: ‘The Order is worthy of honour in its own nature.🔽I will honour the Order with my own share

original: saṅghaṁ paṭipūjessāmī’ti saṅghassa vassikasāṭikaṁ dāpesi, na, mahārāja, tathāgato
analyzed: saṅgham paṭipūjessāmi iti saṅghassa vassika sāṭikam dāpesi na mahā rāja tathāgataḥ
translated: and have the rainy-season robe given to the Order.’ The Tathāgata does not, sire,

original: attano yeva paṭipūjanaṁ vaṇṇeti, atha kho ye loke paṭipūjanārahā, tesampi tathāgato
analyzed: attanaḥ yā iva paṭipūjanam vaṇṇeti atha kho ye loke paṭipūjana arahā tesam pi tathāgato
translated: praise his own honouring, but those in the world who are worthy of honour,🔽the Tathāgata has the rainy-season robe given to the Order.

original: paṭipūjanaṁ vaṇṇeti.
analyzed: paṭipūjanam vaṇṇā iti
translated: and he praises the one who honours him.

analyzed: katamaḥ eka puggalaḥ
